abstracts.cdata!:
The Environmental Management Plan (EMP)
            outlines early discussions with Government authorities on
            the need for an environmental assessment, as required by the
            country's laws and regulations. Public consultations
            were recommended, to inform the community, and use this
            opportunity to determine, a) satisfactory working schedules,
            to minimize noise, and air pollution, and, b) allocation of
            road safety measures. The EMP thus recommends the inclusion
            of conditions on procurement documents, requiring the
            contractors to comply with delivery, and operational
            regulations in accordance with the National Environmental
            Agency of Albania (NEAA). The construction site should limit
            activities to daytime schedules only, in addition to
            installing sound level detectors, and, appropriate traffic
            safety measures should be in place to redirect traffic as
            needed, through defined road signs. Sprinkling systems for
            dust suppression should be installed at construction sites,
            as well as covers to maintain stored materials on site,
            including prevention devices to avoid contaminated runoff
            waters, from polluting surface waters. Water quality testing
            for turbidity and/or suspended solids, should be conducted,
            and the use of air quality monitoring equipment (low cost
            Ringlemann kit) is recommended.
